title: About
content:
This is a static site generated by Struktur's Skribe example stack. Skribe demonstrates how Struktur's class/instance/template pattern can build real-world applications beyond infrastructure configuration. Every page you see here—including the individual blog posts—is generated from structured JSON data validated against schemas and rendered through Handlebars templates.

What makes Skribe interesting is that it uses Struktur's file helper to generate multiple HTML files from a single template. The index.html template doesn't just render the homepage—it iterates over all blog posts and pages, generating individual files for each one. This shows how templates can be generative, not just decorative. All of this happens deterministically: same input data produces identical output every time, making builds auditable and diffable.

Skribe proves that Struktur isn't limited to DevOps or infrastructure domains. Any structured content—documentation, catalogs, reports, or sites like this—can benefit from schema validation, inheritance, and deterministic rendering. The result is a build pipeline that catches errors early, composes cleanly, and outputs exactly what you expect.
